chapters.summary_en: The second chapter of the Bhagavad Gita is Sankhya Yoga. This is the most important chapter of the Bhagavad Gita...
chapters.summary_hi: भगवद गीता का दूसरा अध्याय सांख्य योग है...

shlokas.sanskrit:
धृतराष्ट्र उवाच |
धर्मक्षेत्रे कुरुक्षेत्रे समवेता युयुत्सवः |
मामकाः पाण्डवाश्चैव किमकुर्वत सञ्जय ||१-१||
shlokas.transliteration:
dhṛtarāṣṭra uvāca .
dharmakṣetre kurukṣetre samavetā yuyutsavaḥ .
māmakāḥ pāṇḍavāścaiva kimakurvata sañjaya ||1-1||

translations.sivananda: Dhritarashtra said: What did my people and the sons of Pandu do when they had assembled together eager for battle on the holy plain of Kurukshetra, O Sanjaya.
translations.purohit: The King Dhritarashtra asked: "O Sanjaya! What happened on the sacred battlefield of Kurukshetra, when my people gathered against the Pandavas?"
translations.gambirananda: Dhrtarastra said: O Sanjaya, what did my sons (and others) and Pandu's sons (and others) actually do when, eager for battle, they assembled on the sacred field, the Kuruksetra (Field of the Kurus)?
translations.adidevananda: Dhrtarastra said: On the holy field of Kuruksetra, gathered together eager for battle, what did my people and the Pandavas do, O Sanjaya?

hindi.tejomayananda: ।।1.1।।धृतराष्ट्र ने कहा -- हे संजय ! धर्मभूमि कुरुक्षेत्र में एकत्र हुए युद्ध के इच्छुक मेरे और पाण्डु के पुत्रों ने क्या किया?
hindi.ramsukhdas: ।।1.1।। धृतराष्ट्र बोले - हे संजय! धर्मभूमि कुरुक्षेत्र में युद्ध की इच्छा से इकट्ठे हुए मेरे और पाण्डु के पुत्रों ने भी क्या किया?

shlokas.commentary_en: 1.1 धर्मक्षेत्रे on the holy plain, कुरुक्षेत्रे in Kurukshetra, समवेताः assembled together, युयुत्सवः desirous to fight...

shlokas.sanskrit:
कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन |
मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते सङ्गोऽस्त्वकर्मणि ||२-४७||
shlokas.transliteration:
karmaṇyevādhikāraste mā phaleṣu kadācana .
mā karmaphalaheturbhūrmā te saṅgo'stvakarmaṇi ||2-47||

translations.sivananda: Thy right is to work only, but never with its fruits; let not the fruits of actions be thy motive, nor let thy attachment be to inaction.
translations.purohit: But thou hast only the right to work, but none to the fruit thereof. Let not then the fruit of thy action be thy motive; nor yet be thou enamored of inaction.
translations.gambirananda: Your right is for action alone, never for the results. Do not become the agent of the results of action. May you not have any inclination for inaction.
translations.adidevananda: Your right is to work only and never to its fruit. Do not let the fruit of action be your motive, nor let your attachment be to inaction.

hindi.tejomayananda: ।।2.47।।कर्म करने में ही तेरा अधिकार है, फल में कभी नहीं...
hindi.ramsukhdas: ।।2.47।। कर्म करने में ही तेरा अधिकार है, उसके फलों में कभी नहीं...
